items.name: Dead Wax London Porter
items.desc:
A beer to fit tightly within our ethos at Orbit Beers, paying homage to European brewing heritage and traditions. Named after the runoff area on vinyl records, with a nod to Seven (named for the 7” single) our Double Brown Stout which we have brewed in previous winters at Orbit.
Dead Wax is our take on a classic London Porter. Based on the late nineteenth-century interpretation of the style. Complex rich malt, with aromas of chocolate, coffee, caramel and malty biscuit. More chocolate, coffee and black treacle on the palate. Rich full body, robust bitterness and a subtle earthy/lemony hop character combine to create a distinctively dry and drinkable dark ruby coloured beer.
5.5%
330ml
Vegan

items.name: Ivo Pale Ale
items.desc:
Named for the founder of one of our favourite Independent record labels – 4AD. A man who’s name also inspired the opening track (Ivo) from 4AD band Cocteau Twins’ third album - Treasure.
Lovely golden colour with tropical guava, peach, pine and light citrus on the nose & the palate. Intensely hoppy, with oats for a smooth mouthfeel, & a dry bitter finish. Best enjoyed fresh.
ABV
4.5%
Allergens
Cereals containing gluten
Malt
Golden Promise, Oat Malt, Caramalt
Hops
Challenger, Cascade, Mosaic, Amarillo, Simcoe
Vegan
Yes
Served In
330ml Vichy Bottles

items.name: Lichtenhainer
items.desc:
Lichtenhainer is a 3.8% smoky and lightly sour pale beer from the Saxony area of Germany, an obscure and esoteric beer-style that almost completely disappeared during the 20th century.
It has a gentle smoky flavour imparted by beechwood smoked malted barley, like a distant campfire. A lactic tang of acidity cuts through the bready, cereal-like body to add balance and drinkability in the relative absence of any hop bitterness. The carbonation is lively and brings a crisp & refreshing carbonic bite.
The perfect light beer for when the sharp summer sun fades in to the smoky comfort of Autumn.

items.name: Lockdown Town Pale Ale
items.desc:
A classic west coast style pale ale, hopped with Centennial and Citra, brewed specially for One Night Records Presents 'Lockdown Town'. Lockdown Town is London's first socially distanced Immersive Live Music Event and Venue. Immerse yourself in five musical worlds - from 1950s Rock & Roll to 1918 Ragtime Live music in a maze of tunnels. Dress up for your favourite decade. Themed food & cocktails. The night begins with Rock & Roll in the 1950s and travels back in time with London's best musicians leading you on a whirlwind journey through Jazz, Swing, Delta Blues, Folk, and at last arrive spinning into Ragtime in 1918. Find out more here!
ABV
5.0%
Allergens
Cereals containing gluten
Malt
Craft Pale, Amber, Caramunich
Hops
Centennial, Cascade
Vegan
Yes
Served In
330ml Vichy Bottles

items.desc:
Experience the full range of our beers with a mixed case of everything we've got in stock, this includes our core beers as well as our more experimental, one-off specials from the White Label Series.
In the box this week: Nico, Peel, Ivo, Tzatziki Sour, Nelson Pale, Munich Dunkel, Lichtenhainer, Lockdown Town Pale Ale, Sticke Alt.
(Coming soon: Brewdog Sheperd's Bush Collaboration)

items.name: Mixed Case: White Label Series
items.desc:
Produced in small amounts, white label records are distributed by labels to DJs and radio stations to promote new artists and test the listeners’ reaction to their tracks. Our own white Label Series is an ever-growing collection of one-off releases that explore the experimental side of our brewing. Expect a new limited edition release every month.
In the box this week: Tzatziki Sour, Nelson Pale, Munich Dunkel, Lichtenhainer, Lockdown Town Pale Ale, Sticke Alt)
(Coming soon: Brewdog Sheperd's Bush Collaboration #CollabFest2020)
The makeup of the case is subject to availability

items.name: Mixed Subscription Box
items.desc:
Never run out of Orbit Beers with a mixed case of 24 delivered to your door every month. In the box will be 6 Nico, 6 Ivo, and 12 of our freshest brews including our White Label Series and Digger's Series as and when they are released.
Get your first box for £25!

items.name: Munich Dunkel
items.desc:
Lagered through lockdown for a super clean, smooth beer. Deep, complex & rich malt flavours. Gentle, yet balanced, hop bitterness. Clean and smooth lagered taste, with a full malty body yet a dry & pleasing finish Appearance: Dark walnut brown with a red mahogany tint. Creamy tan head. Aroma: Toasted breadcrumbs, with notes of toffee, chocolate, and hazelnuts.
ABV
5.0%
Allergens
Cereals containing gluten
Malt
Munich Malt, Melanoidin, Carafa III
Hops
Tettnanger, Mittlefruh
Vegan
Yes
Served In
330ml Vichy Bottles

items.name: Nelson Pale
items.desc:
A clean, dry pale ale with a focus on New Zealand hop Nelson Sauvin. Gooseberry, white grape gives a nod to Sauvignon Blanc wine, whilst fellow Kiwi hop Motueka gives a hint of Lime Citrus and fresh-cut grass. Soft mouthfeel and moderately bitter finish. The last beer brewed for us by our exemplary Kiwi brewer Toby before he returns home to live in New Zealand!
ABV
4.9%
Allergens
Cereals Containing Gluten, Wheat
Malt
Golden Promise, Wheat, Craft Pale Malt
Hops
Challenger, Motueka
Vegan
Yes
Served In
330ml Vichy Bottles

items.name: Nico Köln Lager
items.desc:
Named for Christa Päffgen under her singing alias Nico.
Nico hailed from Cologne, the city of Kölsch, an obergäriges (top-fermented) lagerbier.
Pours pale golden. Fragrant herbal hop aroma with lemon citrus and green apple notes. Light on the palate, a touch of bready maltiness, with more assertive hop character. The crisp bitterness makes it eminently drinkable. Look for the pear drop notes from the distinctive Kölsch yeast.
ABV
4.8%
Allergens
Cereals containing gluten
Malt
Lager Malt, Destrin
Hops
Challenger, Tettnanger
Vegan
Yes
Served In
330ml Vichy Bottles

items.name: Peel Belgian Pale Ale
items.desc:
Named for a DJ with one of the most eclectic musical palates in the game. A low strength beer in homage to his famous live studio recording sessions played out regularly on his radio show, and still enjoyed by BBC 6 Music listeners to this day.
Deep gold in colour and intensely hoppy, with banana, clove, bubblegum and spicy black pepper from the Belgian yeast strains and citrus & lime notes from NZ hop Motueka. It's low abv., sturdy bitterness, effervescent body and dry finish make Peel a great pairing beer. Try it with spicy foods & fish dishes or as part of a session!
ABV
4.3%
Allergens
Cereals Containing Gluten, Wheat
Malt
Lager, Wheat, Munich, Oat Husks
Hops
Northern Brewer, Saaz, Motueka
Vegan
Yes
Served In
330ml Vichy Bottles

items.name: Sticke Alt
items.desc:
Inspired by the legend of the Sticke Fest and Sticke Alt. Twice annually, a special strong version of the Dusseldorf Altbier is brewed by three breweries in the Dusseldorf Altstadt (old town). The beer is put on the bar (literally, wooden barrels are hoisted up on to the bar and tapped) twice a year and enjoyed only by locals lucky enough to be in the know regarding the availability of this special release.
Our homage is coppery red with notes of toffee, raisin, bread, spice and herbs. A full body, aggressive bitterness and long, clean finish thanks to the lagering time. A particular nod to Zum Uerige Sticke Altbier, traditionally drunk on the third Tuesday in January and October, as well as ‘Neu’ Orbit’s original strength Altbier from our back catalogue.

items.name: The German Pack
items.desc: Enjoy a mixed case of three of our German-inspired beers just in time for Oktoberfest. Nico, our Kölsch, inspired by the beers of Cologne, our Dunkel inspired by Munich, Lichtenhainer, a smoky sour ale from Saxony & our most recent beer, Sticke Alt, a rare strong altbier released in Dusseldorf only twice a year.

items.name: Tzatziki Sour
items.desc:
Berliner Weisse influenced kettle sour. Inspired by head brewer Paul's double summer holiday to Brussels, Belgium & Symi, Greece. A mildly tart sour beer emulating the flavours of the classic Greek yoghurt dip. A clean, vibrant & zingy summer refresher. Originally brewed by paul at Mad Hatter! We decided to bring the beer back to life down in south London. Straw yellow colour, hazy white foamy head, with aromas of cucumber, mint & lemon & lime citrus with a light malt character. Creamy smooth mouthfeel, with a mildly tart lactic sourness. Light & dry finish with mellow bitterness & soft to medium carbonation.
ABV
4.3%
Allergens
Yoghurt, Cereals containing gluten
Served In
330ml Vichy Bottles
